page.title: 06ENERGY, PADIHAM LANCS
page.content: { Padiham power station}has two 120 MW generating units, one fired by coal & one by oil. Due to high running costs the oil fired unit is in reserve & unlikely to be used. The coal fired unit is amongst the most efficient of its type in Britain. Between 6000 & 7000 tonnes of coal are delivered & burnt each week. A unique feature is that most of the ash in the coal is extracted as a continuously flowing molten stream which falls into water tanks where it is quenched & carried away to storage bunkers awaiting sale for use mainly in grit blasting processes. Each of the two 91 m cooling towers can handle 4400 l of water per second. The station staff consists of about 165 people. 60 of these work a shift system covering 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
